**Information Technology Security Design Specialist for the RCMP**
===============

**Reference:** cb-367-10045783

**Bid Solicitation Number:** 202400234/A

**Notice Publication Date:** June 27, 2024

**Tender Closing Date:** July 16, 2024, 2:00 PM Local Time

**Tender Description:**

The Royal Canadian Mounted Police (RCMP) has an ongoing requirement for a Technical Security Consultant, Level 3, to provide expertise in the specification, procurement, design, implementation, and configuration of secure technical applications and infrastructure solutions for national public safety systems. The consultant will be responsible for ensuring the confidentiality, integrity, and availability of these systems.

**Objective:**

The RCMP's objective is to obtain the services of a security design specialist to assist in the replacement of existing major case management and national intelligence applications. The consultant will be required to develop customized solutions that meet the RCMP's specific security requirements, including level 3 classification and Top Secret clearance.

**Eligibility:**

This bid is open to invited TBIPS (Task-Based Informatics Professional Services) Supply Arrangement Holders who have qualified under Tier 1 for services in the National Capital Region (NCR).

**Contracting Entity:**

* Contracting Entity: Royal Canadian Mounted Police (RCMP)
* Contact Information:
	+ Stacy Seme, Contracting Authority
	+ Email: stacy.seme@rcmp-grc.gc.ca
	+ Telephone: (343) 571-5107

**Notes:**

* The Crown retains the right to negotiate with any supplier on any procurement.
* The RCMP has adopted the Integrity Regime administered by Public Services and Procurement Canada.
* Bidders are advised to regularly consult the Government Electronic Tendering Service (GETS) for the most up-to-date information.

**Indigenous Procurement:**

* The federal Indigenous Business Directory (IBD) is an online resource for identifying Indigenous business capacity.

**Background:**

The RCMP has a requirement to replace the existing major case management and national intelligence applications. The development of new policing systems necessitates the need for infrastructure and services procurement, secure infrastructure solution design, and implementation, as well as configuration to ensure the confidentiality, integrity, and availability of these systems.
